Package model

package model
The model package defines the core data structures and entities used throughout the application.

These classes represent the primary objects in the system—such as users, questions, answers, FAQs, announcements, messages, and reviews—and serve as the bridge between the database layer (databasePart1) and the higher-level application logic (logic and pages packages). Each model encapsulates relevant fields, constructors, and methods to ensure data consistency, integrity, and ease of interaction across all system layers.

Class Summary:

  • Admin – Represents an administrative user with full system management privileges (highest role).
  • Answer – Defines a single answer associated with a specific question, including content, author, and solution status.
  • Answers – Provides utilities for managing collections of Answer objects.
  • Announcement – Represents a system-wide announcement created by a STAFF or ADMIN user, with metadata such as priority, start/end dates, and display type.
  • Clarification – Represents a user-submitted clarification or suggestion related to a question or an answer, aiding collaborative refinement.
  • FAQ – Represents a Frequently Asked Question entry, linking a question and one or more answers marked as solutions. Includes category, staff notes, and metadata about the staff member who created it.
  • FollowUpQ – Represents a follow-up question tied to an existing discussion thread for deeper exploration.
  • Instructor – Represents an instructor-type user, typically with permissions for reviewing, grading, or providing official responses.
  • Messages – Encapsulates private message data exchanged between users (e.g., question authors and reviewers).
  • NavigationBar – Defines the reusable navigational UI model for the application’s layout (menu, buttons, and links).
  • Question – Represents a single user-posted question, including title, description, timestamp, author, and status fields.
  • Questions – Manages loading, filtering, and organizing collections of Question objects.
  • Review – Represents a review posted by a user, typically tied to an answer or piece of content.
  • Reviewer – Defines a reviewer-type user who provides evaluations or feedback on submitted questions or answers.
  • Reviews – Handles aggregation and management of multiple Review objects.
  • Staff – Represents a staff-level user who can manage FAQs, announcements, and other administrative content (role below ADMIN).
  • Student – Represents a standard student user with limited privileges (can post questions, suggest clarifications, and view FAQs).
  • User – The foundational base class for all user types, encapsulating shared fields such as ID, username, password, email, and Role enum.
  • User.Role – Enumerates all role types recognized by the system (ADMIN, STAFF, INSTRUCTOR, STUDENT, REVIEWER, TA, UNKNOWN).
Together, these classes form the foundation of the system’s domain model. They ensure that the data representing user interactions, QA threads, FAQs, reviews, and announcements is consistent, secure, and easily manageable by both the business logic and UI layers.

Used extensively by:

  • logic package – for implementing permission checks, content workflows, and validations.
  • pages package – for building interactive JavaFX-based user interfaces and dashboards.

  • Class
    Description
    Admin
    Represents an administrative user with full privileged access in the system.
    Announcement
    The Announcement class represents a system-wide announcement.
    Announcement.DisplayType
    Display types for announcements
    Announcement.Priority
    Priority levels for announcements
    AnnouncementRead
    Tracks which announcements have been read by which users.
    Answer
    Represents a single answer posted to a question.
    Answers
    The Answers class handles all logic related to managing answers, including creation, editing, deletion, and searching.
    Clarification
     
    FAQ
    Model class representing a Frequently Asked Question (FAQ) entry.
    FollowUpQ
     
    Instructor
    The Instructor class represents a Instructor entity in the system.
    Messages
     
    NavigationBar
     
    Question
    Represents a user-posted question with metadata such as author, title, description, timestamp, tags, and resolution status.
    Questions
     
    Review
    Represents a single review attached to an answer.
    Reviewer
    Represents a reviewer user with permissions to provide feedback and evaluate other users' submissions in the system.
    Reviews
    In-memory manager for Review objects with backing persistence via DatabaseHelper.
    Staff
    Represents a staff user with permissions to create and manage announcements visible to all users mark or remove questions as FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions) All instances of this class are created with the User.Role.STAFF role.
    Student
    Represents a student user with access to questions, answers, and reviews features.
    User
    Representes a generic user in the system, encapsulating common attributes such as ID, username, password, role, name, and email.
    User.Role
